helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION
regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my
order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

I request you to read this email completely and carefully, as every point
mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level attention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under the above-mentioned order ID.
However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items,

And both items were wrong/incorrect medicines,

The remaining 3 items were completely missing.


This is not a minor operational error. This is a serious breach of order
integrity, especially in the pharmaceutical industry where accuracy
directly affects customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed because your team reviewed only
the dispatch video and found no issue.

With due respect, I want to make it very clear that:

A dispatch-level video alone does NOT constitute a complete investigation.

A standard and fair investigation for missing or incorrect medicines must
include:

Review of CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Detailed chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparison at every point

Verification of movement and scan logs

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging or re-routing investigation


Closing a serious complaint based only on the dispatch video is
operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally
unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request PharmEasy to conduct a complete and transparent
chain-of-custody investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

You must review the CCTV footage of:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

Every transit and routing hub

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting area

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

A detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at the origin

Weight during each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


Any mismatch will clearly show missing items.

C. Movement & Scan Audit

A full audit should include:

Outbound scan

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scan

Re-scan or re-routing logs



---

4. Request for Transparency – Provide Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that the relevant CCTV
footage, including:

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my
parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of
the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing
and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety,
accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare
products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves
and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan

-- 


Disclaimer:

This email contains proprietary, business-confidential, 
and/or privileged material. The information contained in this e-mail is 
intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. If 
you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any 
disclosure, copying, distribution or action in relation to the contents of 
this email is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful and request you to 
permanently delete this message and any attachments herein. You are 
requested to advise the sender, of your receipt of this email by return 
e-mail. The Company and its affiliates rule out any and every liability 
resulting from this or any other electronic transmission.

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION
regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my
order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

I request you to read this email completely and carefully, as every point
mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level attention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under the above-mentioned order ID.
However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items,

And both items were wrong/incorrect medicines,

The remaining 3 items were completely missing.


This is not a minor operational error. This is a serious breach of order
integrity, especially in the pharmaceutical industry where accuracy
directly affects customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed because your team reviewed only
the dispatch video and found no issue.

With due respect, I want to make it very clear that:

A dispatch-level video alone does NOT constitute a complete investigation.

A standard and fair investigation for missing or incorrect medicines must
include:

Review of CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Detailed chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparison at every point

Verification of movement and scan logs

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging or re-routing investigation


Closing a serious complaint based only on the dispatch video is
operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally
unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request PharmEasy to conduct a complete and transparent
chain-of-custody investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

You must review the CCTV footage of:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

Every transit and routing hub

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting area

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

A detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at the origin

Weight during each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


Any mismatch will clearly show missing items.

C. Movement & Scan Audit

A full audit should include:

Outbound scan

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scan

Re-scan or re-routing logs



---

4. Request for Transparency – Provide Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that the relevant CCTV
footage, including:

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my
parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of
the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing
and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety,
accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare
products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves
and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan

--

intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. If 
you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any

notes.body_html:
Hello Nikhil,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #655879610256134144-85747, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.

As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 13th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future. 

We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION
regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my
order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

I request you to read this email completely and carefully, as every point
mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level attention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under the above-mentioned order ID.
However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items,

And both items were wrong/incorrect medicines,

The remaining 3 items were completely missing.


This is not a minor operational error. This is a serious breach of order
integrity, especially in the pharmaceutical industry where accuracy
directly affects customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed because your team reviewed only
the dispatch video and found no issue.

With due respect, I want to make it very clear that:

A dispatch-level video alone does NOT constitute a complete investigation.

A standard and fair investigation for missing or incorrect medicines must
include:

Review of CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Detailed chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparison at every point

Verification of movement and scan logs

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging or re-routing investigation


Closing a serious complaint based only on the dispatch video is
operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally
unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request PharmEasy to conduct a complete and transparent
chain-of-custody investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

You must review the CCTV footage of:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

Every transit and routing hub

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting area

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

A detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at the origin

Weight during each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


Any mismatch will clearly show missing items.

C. Movement & Scan Audit

A full audit should include:

Outbound scan

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scan

Re-scan or re-routing logs



---

4. Request for Transparency – Provide Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that the relevant CCTV
footage, including:

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my
parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of
the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing
and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety,
accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare
products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves
and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan

--

permanently delete this message and any attachments herein. You are 
requested to advise the sender, of your receipt of this email by return 
e-mail. The Company and its affiliates rule out any and every liability 
resulting from this or any other electronic transmission.

notes.body: Hello Suruchi,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to your order #658059489101811712-12807, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.     As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 12th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.     We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.     For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.      Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!     Regards,  PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Suruchi,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #658059489101811712-12807, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.

As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 12th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.

We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

This email is in regards to the concern raised about your order #657293137642590208-54269.Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused.     As per update received from our team, please be informed that all medicines were packed and delivered to you in proper, good and intatc condition as checked with our warehouse team. We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us. notes.body:
Merged from ticket 22278798  
      Subject: Too much Delay in medicine delivery  
      Description:  Hello sir,  
   
 Here i have one complaint against your company. PharmEasy - a brand name in online medicine supply. And from last few months, I see a Tagore line of - "same day delivery". 
   
 My order id :656872730591002624 
 Order placed on: 8-12-25 
   
 Without informing me some medicines are cancelled in the delivering set. 
 Original delivery date is 10th December but on that day I can't get my delivery of medicine.  
 When I call to customer care then I got inform that within 24 hours I will get my delivery  
 Till today when I writing this mail on 13th December time is 7:00 p.m. from your customer care centre she said me we will try to give your medicine today.  
   
 I can't understand that when you are branding in online medicine supply and you have use chain for supply of medicines and I am live in mid City not long distance like as the side of the village.  
   
 Why your company not able to delivery me in time ???? 
   
 Find the problem and solve that , because due to some other team or person for delivery of medicine name became spoil.  
   
 I have order this medicine for my (senior citizen) father and due to 3 days late delivery till I can't get medicines so I have to purchase this all medicine set from nearby store. I have spend twice money one at your store and second at nearby store. 
   
  who is responsible for this ??? 
   
   
 To customer care lady I also request that if your company is not able to provide me my medicine set on before tonight then give me total refund. 
   
 And I also say to your company that remove your tagline same day delivery because you are not able to fulfill this line. 
   
 Regards,  
 Rajan shah  
 
 Disclaimer:

notes.body_html:
Merged from ticket 22278798

Subject: Too much Delay in medicine delivery

Description:
Hello sir, 

Here i have one complaint against your company. PharmEasy - a brand name in online medicine supply. And from last few months, I see a Tagore line of - "same day delivery".

My order id :656872730591002624
Order placed on: 8-12-25

Without informing me some medicines are cancelled in the delivering set.
Original delivery date is 10th December but on that day I can't get my delivery of medicine. 
When I call to customer care then I got inform that within 24 hours I will get my delivery 
Till today when I writing this mail on 13th December time is 7:00 p.m. from your customer care centre she said me we will try to give your medicine today. 

I can't understand that when you are branding in online medicine supply and you have use chain for supply of medicines and I am live in mid City not long distance like as the side of the village. 

Why your company not able to delivery me in time ????

Find the problem and solve that , because due to some other team or person for delivery of medicine name became spoil. 

I have order this medicine for my (senior citizen) father and due to 3 days late delivery till I can't get medicines so I have to purchase this all medicine set from nearby store. I have spend twice money one at your store and second at nearby store.

 who is responsible for this ???


To customer care lady I also request that if your company is not able to provide me my medicine set on before tonight then give me total refund.

And I also say to your company that remove your tagline same day delivery because you are not able to fulfill this line.

Regards, 
Rajan shah

Due to some unforeseen circumstances, the estimated date for the delivery of your order was changed. Please accept my apologies for the same.  I noticed, we have already escalated the issue to our team and requested them to dispatch and deliver your order at the earliest. As soon as we receive an update, we will notify you.      You can refer to the ticket Id #22273208. Your patience and understanding are highly appreciated in the meantime.     Regards,  Neeha

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Hi,
This is regarding my order 574637560338030592
I have attached a prescription of my mother (MANIKUMARI TEKI)
But, on the invoice, my father's name is there.
Correct the name and send the invoice.
Also, I noticed that doctor name was also not taken from the prescription.
Because of this, my company had rejected the bill claim.
Providing the correct details below:

*Patient Name*: MANIKUMARI TEKI
*Doctor Name*: Syed Imran

Attaching the invoice and the prescription for your reference

Also, when i try calling your customer care number, it says, "seems you
have not ordered anything recently and just disconnects". This is
completely unacceptable.

-- 
regards,
venkat

--

notes.body: Hello Venkat,     Greetings from PharmEasy!    I understand your concern is regarding your order #574637560338030592-26994. As per the system, the order has been delivered to you on 29th April 2025. Any changes that need to be made to the invoice can be accepted within 30 days of the order delivery. Hence, we regret to inform you that we are unable to comply with your request to make the changes.   Please be informed that for non-prescription medicines/products, the invoice is prepared as per the profile name mentioned at the time of placing the order. If the prescription is uploaded for non-prescription medicines/products, the invoice will be prepared as per the uploaded prescription.      For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels, on the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.      Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy!     Regards,  Habiba

notes.body: Hello,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     I am sorry to hear that you wish to delete your account with PharmEasy. Please note that currently, we do not have a facility to delete the account from our database; however, we can deactivate your account. We will be unable to activate it later, and it will be deactivated permanently.     Once your request has been processed in the system, our agent will call within 24 to 48 hours on a registered mobile number and confirm if you have requested account deactivation. After verification, an OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number.  Once the OTP is verified, the agent will go ahead and deactivate your account       Kindly confirm so that we can proceed with the request.     Awaiting your earliest response.     Regards,  Habiba

notes.body: Hello,     Greetings from PharmEasy!         I understand that you wish to raise a return request for your order #606461971700457472-44906. Please be informed that the return validity for FOLVITE MB STRIP OF 15 CAPSULES and FERTISURE F STRIP OF 10 TABLETS was 30 days and 15 days from the date of delivery.    Your order is delivered to you on 26th July 2025, and the return window is closed. I would have surely helped you if you had contacted us within the reporting timeframe. Hence, we will be unable to return the requested medicine or process a refund. Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you.   PharmEasy offers a flexible return policy for items ordered with us. Under this policy, each item purchased will have a returnable window which can vary anywhere between 0 to 7 days, post its delivery. The return window is listed in the returns section of the order, once delivered. You may check the below link to know about our return policy,  https://PharmEasy.in/help/returns-43000349468/how-does-PharmEasy-s-return-policy-work--43000220410     For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.          Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy!     Regards,  Habiba

notes.body: Hello Bhavesh,     Greetings from PharmEasy!  I understand your concern regarding the doctor consultation. I will surely assist you with the same.     I would like to inform you that PharmEasy provides free doctor consultations only when an order is placed and the prescribed medicine requires a valid prescription. In such cases, once the order is placed, we arrange a free consultation to help generate the required prescription.     Kindly confirm whether you have already placed an order or if you are seeking a different type of consultation so that we can assist you accordingly.     Additionally, if you have seen any communication or image stating that a free consultation is available without placing an order, please share the screenshot in JPG or PNG format. This will help us review the matter and take appropriate action.     Awaiting your response.   Regards,  Habiba

notes.body: Hello Faiyaz,      Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to your order #656681391670317056-99370, I am sorry to know you have not received your ordered medicine GTN SORBITRATE CR 6.4MG BOTTLE OF 30 TABLETS of 1 quantity. This is certainly not the kind of experience that we wanted you to have with our services. I apologize for the inconvenience caused to you.     I have highlighted the issue to our partner retailer. The issue is being investigated; this will take 24-48 hours from the time of reporting the issue. Once the issue is verified, we will try to initiate a refund for the missing medicines. We will inform you of the status once we receive an update from our partner retailer.     Once the refund is initiated, it will reflect in your PharmEasy wallet within 24 hours. Also, please confirm whether the order was delivered in intact condition.     I appreciate your patience in the meantime.     Regards,  Sandhya Nackwal
